channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: My Word for 2024: Strong
item.description: Before I begin, know that I fully recognize that it’s May. I selected my word of the year way back in December of 2023. After letting it marinade for a few days, I spent an hour looking for the perfect bracelet on Etsy that would display its letters each and every day. I also knew... Read More

item.title: How To Start A Successful Health Coaching Business (Yes, You Can!)
item.description: Start your journey helping people make life-changing health shifts.

item.title: Mayo Clinic Minute: Keeping kids safe outside during summer play
item.description: Summer vacation for kids is well underway. Finding activities to keep the kids busy and destinations to visit can be on many parents' list. There is one place Mayo Clinic's Dr. Steven Maher hopes they don't have to visit — and that's the emergency medicine department. From wearing bike helmets to keeping kids hydrated, Dr. […] The post Mayo Clinic Minute: Keeping kids safe outside during summer play appeared first on Mayo Clinic News Network .

item.title: The Sound of Freedom
item.description: For a million years (more like 15,) I’ve been listening to a radio show: The Taylor Strecker Show. It’s a daily show that originated on SiriusXM and through a series of events became an independently broadcasted show on Patreon. There’s something interesting that happens when you listen to a daily show. You get to know... Read More

item.title: No Lie, This Supplement Is Like The Fountain Of Youth For Your Skin
item.description: Do you do your skin care routine morning and night? Great. But there's more you can do. Here's how to approach skin aging from the inside out.

item.title: Can you prevent cancer with lifestyle changes?
item.description: Nearly half of cancer deaths in the U.S. are associated with preventable risk factors — such as smoking and alcohol use — according to a new American Cancer Society study. Dr. Jon Ebbert, medical director of the Mayo Clinic Nicotine Dependence Center, says it's never too late to make lifestyle changes that can decrease your risk of […] The post Can you prevent cancer with lifestyle changes? appeared first on Mayo Clinic News Network .

item.title: That Time I Went to the Eras Tour [Part Two]
item.description: To review part one of this adventure with Taylor Swift, click here. Click here to see all the Instagram highlight videos from Denver Night One. item.title: In A Financial Pinch? 7 Small Savings Tips That Add Up To Big Savings
item.description: Don’t dismiss the power of baby steps, especially when it comes to saving money. Small money moves can add up to big savings.

item.title: That Time I Went to the Eras Tour [Part One]
item.description: Do you ever have one of those experiences where you want to remember exactly how you felt? That’s how I feel about my experience at the Taylor Swift concert this weekend. item.title: A 7-Week Plan To Master Pull-Ups (& Why This Move Is A+ For Healthy Aging)
item.description: Pull-ups are way more than just a flex—they can actively boost longevity and health span.

item.title: Mayo Clinic Minute: Dangers of heat-related illnesses
item.description: Scorching temperatures continue to blanket much of the U.S. in an ongoing summer heat wave. Prolonged exposure to both heat and humidity can lead to heat-related illnesses — from heat cramps to exhaustion to life-threatening heatstroke. Dr. Jesse Bracamonte, a Mayo Clinic family physician, offers recommendations on what to do if you begin to feel ill. Watch: The Mayo […] The post Mayo Clinic Minute: Dangers of heat-related illnesses appeared first on Mayo Clinic News Network .

item.title: Jenny Craig Recipe Creation: Turkey Philly Baguette
item.description: Special thanks to Jenny Craig for their sponsorship of this post. In honor of the Super Bowl this year, I decided to make a Philly to enjoy. item.title: Are Creatine Supplements Bad For Your Kidneys? What's Fact vs. Fiction
Sports Safety Spotlight: Mayo advises teens on how to get back in the game safely after shoulder injury
item.description: AUSTIN, Minn. ― For teens who love playing summer team sports, an injury that takes them out of the game can be devastating. Shoulder injuries are among the most common for athletes who play volleyball, tennis, swimming, football and a variety of others. "The shoulder is an incredibly mobile joint that allows you to reach […] The post Sports Safety Spotlight: Mayo advises teens on how to get back in the game safely after shoulder injury appeared first on Mayo Clinic News Network .
